{"step_by_step_thinking": "Inclusions are non-living substances that are not bound by membranes and are stored in the cytoplasm. They can be nutrients, secretory products, and pigment granules. From the given options, glycogen is a stored nutrient and can be considered as an inclusion of the cytoplasm. The other options, endoplasmic reticulum, ribosome, and Golgi body, are organelles, not inclusions.", "answer_choice": "D. Glycogen"}
